titles.title: To facilitate the resolution of a minor boundary encroachment on lands of the Union Pacific Railroad Company in Tipton, California, which were originally conveyed by the United States as part of the right-of-way granted for the construction of transcontinental railroads.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-714.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 436.

action.text: Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4817.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 9/30/2004--Reported to House amended. Releases, without consideration, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the surface portion of property located at 615 North Burnett Road in Tipton, California, which encroaches upon land originally conveyed by the United States to the Union Pacific Railroad Company as part of a right-of-way for the construction of transcontinental railroads. Declares that the United States retains any subsurface mineral rights held by it with respect to such property.
